channel.title: Help
channel.description:
okay the guides for portforwarduing i under stand them but when i type in ipconfig or other ones it says-[IMG]http://i32.tinypic.com/vukc9.jpg[/img]
is there any other way for finding this plz post back(if this is in wrong section plz tell me)
:edit: [u][b]FIXED[/b][/u]

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @mikeyismyname mikeyismyname
item.description:
@mikeyismyname wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:6, topic:287513”]I had the same problem, go to your Environment variables, and add a new system variable named path, in it add:

C:\windows\system32

Worked for me.[/quote]
tyvm
greatly apreciate it

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

I had the same problem, go to your Environment variables, and add a new system variable named path, in it add:

C:\windows\system32

Worked for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

[quote=“mikeyismyname, post:3, topic:287513”][quote author=Fireweaver0 link=topic=380162.msg2858001#msg2858001 date=1246999109]
It says the most likely due to the fact that you messed up on your environment variables. You are not supposed to edit your SYSTEM variables only your USER (well you could put it in SYSTEM but you would also need your path to have windows32 in it). Put your CLASSPATH and Path in USER and in SYSTEM put this

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem

[/quote]
okay i move the path and classpath to user environment variables but about the %SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem
what should i name it in system environment variables??[/quote]

Sorry name that Path
then try ipconfig again

Read full topic
